node.description:
# Image Sentiment Analysis
Classify images uploaded to the Playground by sentiment.

## Prerequisites

* [OpenAI API Key](https://platform.openai.com/)

## Quickstart

1. In the **Language Model** component, add your OpenAI API key.

2. Open the **Playground**, and then submit an image to the chat. 

The LLM analyzes the image. The sentiment is output into a structured table according to the **Structured Output** component's Output Schema, and then parsed into a message for the Playground to display.

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

mode.info: Choose variable syntax for your template.
mode.name: mode

template.name: template
template.value: Classify the image into neutral, negative or positive.

tool_placeholder.info: A placeholder input for tool mode.
tool_placeholder.name: tool_placeholder

node.description: Format a DataFrame or Data object into text using a template. Enable 'Stringify' to convert input into a readable string instead.

input_data.info: Accepts either a DataFrame or a Data object.
input_data.name: input_data

mode.info: Convert into raw string instead of using a template.
mode.name: mode

pattern.info: Use variables within curly brackets to extract column values for DataFrames or key values for Data.For example: `Name: {Name}, Age: {Age}, Country: {Country}`
pattern.name: pattern

node.description: Uses an LLM to generate structured data. Ideal for extraction and consistency.

input_value.info: The input message to the language model.
input_value.name: input_value

output_schema.info: Define the structure and data types for the model's output.
output_schema.name: output_schema

table_schema.description: Specify the name of the output field.
table_schema.name: name

table_schema.description: Describe the purpose of the output field.
table_schema.name: description

table_schema.description: Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict).
table_schema.name: type

table_schema.description: Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.
table_schema.name: multiple

value.description: A Positive|Negative value that represents the image.
value.name: sentiment

schema_name.info: Provide a name for the output data schema.
schema_name.name: schema_name

system_prompt.info: The instructions to the language model for formatting the output.
system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

node.description: Runs a language model given a specified provider.

base_url_ibm_watsonx.info: The base URL of the API (IBM watsonx.ai only)
base_url_ibm_watsonx.name: base_url_ibm_watsonx

input_value.info: The input text to send to the model
input_value.name: input_value

ollama_base_url.info: Endpoint of the Ollama API (Ollama only). Defaults to http://localhost:11434
ollama_base_url.name: ollama_base_url

project_id.info: The project ID associated with the foundation model (IBM watsonx.ai only)
project_id.name: project_id

system_message.info: A system message that helps set the behavior of the assistant
system_message.name: system_message

description: Analyzes images and categorizes them as positive, negative, or neutral using zero-shot learning.
name: Image Sentiment Analysis
